articles.author: Nandita Bose
articles.description: The falling-out began brewing days ago when Musk denounced Trump's tax-cut and spending bill.
articles.title: Trump is not interested in talking to Musk as they feud over tax-cut bill

articles.author: Thomas Peter, Anna Voitenko, Anastasiia Malenko
articles.description: The air force said Russia had used 407 drones, one of the largest numbers recorded in a single attack.
articles.title: Three killed, 49 wounded in intense Russian air attacks on Ukraine

articles.author: Laurie Chen
articles.description: China has signalled for more than 15 years that it was looking to weaponise areas of the global supply chain, a strategy modelled on longstanding American export controls Beijing views as aimed at stalling its rise.
articles.title: China’s rare earth weapon changes contours of trade war battlefield

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: U.S. President Donald Trump is not interested in talking to Elon Musk, a White House source with knowledge of the matter said on Friday, the morning after a huge public clash between the two men.
articles.title: Trump not interested in talking to Musk, White House source says

articles.author: Mark Trevelyan
articles.description: Russia sees little chance of saving its last nuclear accord with the United States, due to expire in eight months, given the "ruined" state of relations with Washington, its top arms control official said in an interview published on Friday.
articles.title: Russia sees bleak prospects for expiring nuclear arms pact given 'ruined' ties with US

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: A French rabbi was attacked on Friday for the second time in a week, he told Reuters, reflecting a broad rise in hate crimes across France that has included high-profile anti-Semitic assaults.
articles.title: French rabbi tells of two attacks in one week as hate crimes rise

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: The International Committee of the Red Cross says it has suspended its operations in Niger after the West African nation's government ordered the closure of its offices, citing alleged collusion with armed groups.
articles.title: Red Cross halts operations in Niger after government directive

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: China and France have agreed to resolve their trade disputes through dialogue, China's foreign ministry said on Friday, though there was no indication that agreement had been reached in talks on lifting Chinese levies on European brandy.
articles.title: China says it is working with France on trade differences, no sign yet of a cognac deal

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Russian air defence forces shot down three drones attempting to attack Moscow, Sergei Sobyanin, the Russian capital's mayor, said on Friday.
articles.title: Russia downed three drones targeting Moscow, mayor says

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Russia's Wagner mercenary group said on Friday it was leaving Mali after fighting Islamist militants for three-and-a-half years and returning home after its mission in the African country had been successfully completed.
articles.title: Russia's Wagner mercenary group says it is leaving Mali after 'mission accomplished'
